unnormalised: The construction of the new metro line in Bengaluru has hit a snag. Initial estimates placed the project completion date in late 2024, but recent reports indicate a delay.
normalised: The construction of the new metro line in Bengaluru has hit a snag. Initial estimates placed the project completion date in late two thousand and twenty four, but recent reports indicate a delay.

unnormalised: The issue stems from inconsistent measurements during the initial surveying phase. It appears that a discrepancy of approximately 200 meters exists in the planned route, impacting land acquisition and tunnel boring. "We are working tirelessly to resolve this issue," stated BMRCL spokesperson, Ms. Priya Sharma. “The error originated in the initial blueprint, where a crucial section was miscalculated to be 1.5 km instead of 1.7 km."
normalised: The issue stems from inconsistent measurements during the initial surveying phase. It appears that a discrepancy of approximately two hundred meters exists in the planned route, impacting land acquisition and tunnel boring. "We are working tirelessly to resolve this issue," stated B-M-R-C-L spokesperson, M-S. Priya Sharma. “The error originated in the initial blueprint, where a crucial section was miscalculated to be one point five kilometer instead of one point seven kilometer."

unnormalised: Further complicating matters, different teams were using varying units of measurement. Some used the metric system (meters and kilometers), while others referenced older, local units like *hasta* and *angula*, leading to misinterpretations and errors during conversion. One engineer mentioned that “There were instances when tunnel depth was being planned in feet (ft) instead of meters. 5 ft difference may not look much on paper, but it makes huge differences in tunnel excavation.”
normalised: Further complicating matters, different teams were using varying units of measurement. Some used the metric system (meters and kilometers), while others referenced older, local units like hasta and angula, leading to misinterpretations and errors during conversion. One engineer mentioned that “There were instances when tunnel depth was being planned in feet (f-t) instead of meters. five feet difference may not look much on paper, but it makes huge differences in tunnel excavation.”

unnormalised: This confusion has resulted in sections of completed track that don't align correctly with the planned stations. Corrective measures are now underway, costing the project an estimated ₹ 50 crore and further delaying the launch by at least 6 months.
normalised: This confusion has resulted in sections of completed track that do not align correctly with the planned stations. Corrective measures are now underway, costing the project an estimated rupee fifty crore and further delaying the launch by at least six months.

unnormalised: The ripple effects of this error are significant. Local businesses along the route face extended disruption, and commuters eagerly awaiting the new metro line will have to wait longer. The BMRCL has promised a thorough investigation to prevent similar measurement mishaps in future infrastructure projects, and emphasize usage of consistent units like meters, centimeters, and kilometers.

The B-M-R-C-L has promised a thorough investigation to prevent similar measurement mishaps in future infrastructure projects, and emphasize usage of consistent units like meters, centimeters, and kilometers.
